hanzi-su-wiki:
県

Значения

Префектура

Мнемоника

  • Перевернутый знак вождь 首 в значении «уездный город», где устраивались публичные казни, как правило, подвешиванием за ноги. В Японии — префектура.

  • "Правительство следит 目 за маленькими 小 префектурами."

Варианты

縣, 县, 𥄉
purpleculture_pinyin:
xiàn
Japanese variant of 县 ; Japanese prefecture
Японский вариант 县; Префектура Японии
rtega_mnemonic:
県県RS
X		prefecture
  • the eye 目 of the govt. controlling the small 小 corners ㇗ of the country
府 道; 州; 懸

県県RScounty, district, subdivision, prefecture
  • head with an eye 目 of a hung person ㇗ with hanging hair: 𥄉 → 県: the county officials are merciless for burglars
府 道; 州; 懸
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 小 indicates the sound; 目 (head) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
福冈県 [ fú gāng xiàn ]: Fukuoka prefecture in north Kyūshū 九州 , Japan
宫崎県 [ gōng qí xiàn ]: Miyazaki prefecture in east Kyūshū 九州 , Japan
秋田県 [ qiū tián xiàn ]: Akita prefecture in north of Honshū island, Japan
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • ⿺ Surround from lower left
      • 目 [ mù ] eye; to look, to see; division, topic
    • 小 [ xiǎo ] small, tiny, insignificant
heisig_story: Above, an eye and a fishhook, and below the primitive for little. Although apparently the simplest of these first six kanji, when you begin to work on its plot and story you will soon find out that the number of strokes and visual complexity of a kanji does not make it easier or harder to remember. It is the primitives you have to work that are the critical factor, as in this case where the meaning of the key word is so seemingly distant from the elements. Remember, you can always break larger elements down (eye of a needle into eye and fishhook) if you think it helps.
koohiiStory1: In Japanese this is KEN, as in Barbie´s boyfriend. He has lovely blue eyes, a girlfriend who is as thin as a straightened out fish hook. But, down where it counts, he has very little to show...
koohiiStory2: After sticking a fishhook in your eye, the yakuza boss probably has little more to do to convince you to move to a different prefecture.
jp_example_words:
県(けん): prefecture
県庁(けんちょう): prefectural office
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The eye of a small lion gazes upon the prefecture that will one day become his. He’s a small lion prince, but once he grows up, everything reflected in his eye will be his prefecture to rule over.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You remember the old classic movie about the white lion and his prefecture. No? Oh, you're thinking of that big studio knock off. That's okay, whatever makes you remember the laws of prefectural rule.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This small lion's prefecture is being protected by Ken (けん) the samurai because the lion is too small to protect all of this land himself. Ken the samurai is used to wandering far and wide, so one, eye-sized prefecture is nothing to him.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Ken protecting the prefecture, punching hyenas in the face, and yelling, "This may just be a prefecture, not a country, but I'll give it my all for my lion king!"
Ru_AutoNotes: Япония официально делится на 47 административных единиц высшего уровня — префектуры. Они объединены в систему тодофукэн (都道府県とどうふけん). По этой системе страна состоит из столичной префектуры то (都と) — Токио, губернаторства до: (道どう) — Хоккайдо, двух городов фу (府ふ), имеющих статус префектур, — Киото и Осака — и сорока трёх префектур кэн (県けん).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the small (小) eye (目) on the shelf (𠃊) is keeping watch over the prefecture

xiàn
яп. вм. 县

県

Значения

Префектура

Мнемоника

  • Перевернутый знак вождь 首 в значении «уездный город», где устраивались публичные казни, как правило, подвешиванием за ноги. В Японии — префектура.

  • "Правительство следит 目 за маленькими 小 префектурами."

Варианты

縣, 县, 𥄉

Radicals: 目, L, 小  (eye, lion, small)
Meaning Mnemonic
The eye of a small lion gazes upon the prefecture that will one day become his. He’s a small lion prince, but once he grows up, everything reflected in his eye will be his prefecture to rule over.
You remember the old classic movie about the white lion and his prefecture. No? Oh, you're thinking of that big studio knock off. That's okay, whatever makes you remember the laws of prefectural rule.
Reading Mnemonic
This small lion's prefecture is being protected by Ken (けん) the samurai because the lion is too small to protect all of this land himself. Ken the samurai is used to wandering far and wide, so one, eye-sized prefecture is nothing to him.
Picture Ken protecting the prefecture, punching hyenas in the face, and yelling, "This may just be a prefecture, not a country, but I'll give it my all for my lion king!"

MDBG | BKRS | WriCh | Qianyix | YBridge | Collocs | ChPop | SimCh | Stats | Google Images | Char lookup site

小 (маленький), 目 (глаз)

Япония официально делится на 47 административных единиц высшего уровня — префектуры. Они объединены в систему тодофукэн (都道府県とどうふけん). По этой системе страна состоит из столичной префектуры то (都と) — Токио, губернаторства до: (道どう) — Хоккайдо, двух городов фу (府ふ), имеющих статус префектур, — Киото и Осака — и сорока трёх префектур кэн (県けん).
